Description: Pointed-topped limestone stela divided into two registers: Upper - Standard of the West flanked by the figures of Isis and Nephthys kneeling in adoration. Lower - Scene of two figures seated on either side of a table; six columns of Hieroglyphic text above. The inscription identifies both figures as akh ikr n Ra and names the man on the left as Pennub, and that on the right as Khamwy.
Curator's comments: Published Kitchen Ram. Insc. Vol 4 p443 Published: HTBM Part 9: Plate XLI PM I Part 2: p.725 The persons named on the stela are also depicted on the stela EA 359.
